definition: Horse-Face, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Now, the search is on to unmask the mystery prankster。
sentences.chinese: 现在人们正试图找出神秘马面人到底是谁。

sentences.english: So, you can see many ox- faces working for the King of Hell.
sentences.chinese: 咁所以帮阎罗王打工个喳都系牛头多过马面。

sentences.english: A busy street in the middle of Bamako, Mali.
sentences.chinese: 图中是马面共跟国巴马科市中心的一条繁闲的街讲。

definition: Two deities, one short, one tall, chained together at the ankle, responsible for rewarding the good and punishing the bad
Ox-Head, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja
to scowl and stare down/to defy
